name: Samify.js
body:
### Responsive, flexible table-like layouts Samify.js is a dead simple, lightweight jQuery plugin that allows you to create responsive, flexible, table-like layouts. Whether it's equal height, equal width, both or even equalized by each row and column (table-like), samify.js lets you quickly create equalized DOM elements. It's simple: ```html

...

...

...

``` ```js $(".box").samify(); ``` ### Options The `samify()` method takes a single options object with the following keys: ##### `height` Default: `true` This will equalize all elements to the height of the largest sibling. ##### `width` Default: `false` Same as `height`, but equalizes widths to the width of the widest element. ##### `vshrink` Default: `false` This overrides the `height` option. This will equalize each row to the height of the largest element in each row. E.g. In a grid 3 wide and 2 high, the top row will equalize to the height of the largest element among the first 3 elements. The bottom row will equalize to the maximum height of the last 3 elements. ##### `hshrink` Default: `false` Same as `vshrink`, but equalizes by column. ##### cols Default: `0` This can be either a `number` or a `function`. If a number, the number of columns will always remain fixed. If a function, the number of columns can be dynamic and recalculated on resize. The function takes on parameter, the window width. Note: You must also set `resize` to `true` for the function to recalculate on resize, it will be called only once otherwise. ```js $(".box").samify({ 'resize': true, 'cols': function (width) { ... } }); ``` ##### resize Default: `false` Whether or not to bind to window resize and recalculate sizes and columns on resize. ##### throttle Default: `250` The delay in ms that the grid will be resized on window resize.
